questions.question: What is a single tooth implant made of?
How long does the implant usually take to fuse with the jawbone?
What is the biggest benefit of a single tooth implant?
options: A) It is the cheapest option
B) It stops bone loss and looks natural
D) No need for any surgery

questions.question: After implant placement, when is the final crown fixed?
What is the success rate of single tooth implants after 10 years?
Who should NOT get an implant without extra care?
options: B) Smoker or person with uncontrolled diabetes

questions.question: During implant surgery, do you feel pain?
options: B) No – local anesthesia is given

questions.question: What happens if you don’t replace a missing tooth with an implant?
options: B) Neighbouring teeth shift and bone melts away

questions.question: How many implants are usually placed for 2–4 missing teeth?
What is the main advantage over a traditional bridge?
options: A) No healthy teeth are cut

questions.question: Healing time is same as single tooth implant?
Can multiple implants support individual crowns?
Main risk is same as single implant:
After healing, the final teeth are
options: B) Fixed crowns or small bridge

questions.question: Why is it better than one big bridge on natural teeth?
options: A) Preserves bone and healthy teeth

questions.question: How many implants are used for the entire upper or lower jaw?
What is “Teeth in a Day”?
options: A) Temporary teeth fixed on same day of surgery
B) Final teeth in one day

questions.question: Success rate of All-on-4 after 5–10 years?
Main benefit compared to complete denture?
After surgery you get
options: B) Temporary fixed teeth same day

questions.question: All-on-6 is safer than All-on-4 because
options: A) More implants share the load

questions.question: Can you eat normally after final bridge?
options: B) Yes, almost like natural teeth

questions.question: Who usually chooses full arch implants?
options: A) People with all teeth missing or badly damaged
B) People with only one tooth missing
D) People who want removable dentures

questions.question: How many implants support a bridge of 3–5 teeth?
Advantage over traditional bridge?
options: A) No grinding of healthy side teeth

questions.question: Why is bone preserved?
options: A) Implants act like natural roots

questions.question: Best for?
options: A) 3–5 missing teeth in a row

questions.question: How many implants are usually placed?
How does the denture stay in place?
Chewing efficiency compared to normal denture?
Main benefit?
options: A) No more loose denture while eating/speaking

questions.question: Why is bone grafting done?
options: A) When there is not enough bone for implant

questions.question: Success rate of bone graft?
options: A) Up to 100% when done correctly

questions.question: Common sources of bone?
options: A) Patient’s own, donor or synthetic

questions.question: After grafting, what covers the bone?
Is bone grafting painful?
options: A) Done under local anesthesia, mild discomfort

questions.question: Can implant be placed without grafting if bone is enough?
What is a crown?
options: A) Cap that covers the whole tooth
D) Thin shell only on front

questions.question: How long does a crown usually last?
Risk of needing root canal after crown?
Temporary crown is given
options: A) While permanent is being made

questions.question: Can you eat normally after permanent crown?
options: A) Yes, after anesthesia wears off

questions.question: Biggest benefit?
options: A) Saves damaged tooth and makes it strong

questions.question: How many missing teeth can a bridge replace?
Healthy teeth on sides are
options: A) Cut and covered with crowns

questions.question: Main disadvantage?
options: A) Bone loss under missing tooth area

questions.question: How long does bridge usually last?
Bridge is
options: A) Fixed, cannot be removed by patient

questions.question: Compared to implant bridge?
options: A) Faster and cheaper but damages healthy teeth

questions.question: After bridge cementation, you can eat
Complete denture is used when?
options: A) All teeth in one jaw are missing

questions.question: How many visits are usually needed?
Chewing power compared to natural teeth?
Main problem over time?
options: A) Bone shrinks → denture becomes loose

questions.question: Denture should be removed
options: A) At night for cleaning and gum rest

questions.question: Sore spots are
options: A) Common in first few weeks, adjusted by dentist

questions.question: Benefit?
options: A) Restores smile and basic chewing quickly

questions.question: Partial denture is used when?
options: A) Some natural teeth still remain

questions.question: Main disadvantage?
options: A) May feel bulky, clasps visible sometimes

questions.question: How often should it be removed?
Adjustments are done
options: A) In first few weeks if sore

questions.question: Veneer is
options: A) Thin porcelain shell on front of tooth

questions.question: Best for
options: A) Front teeth – colour, shape, gaps

questions.question: Can you eat hard food?
options: A) Yes, but avoid very hard things like ice

questions.question: Main benefit?
options: A) Beautiful smile with minimal tooth reduction

questions.question: Full mouth rehabilitation means
options: A) Complete makeover of all teeth using crowns, veneers, implants etc.

questions.question: How long does treatment usually take?
Temporary restorations are used
options: A) Yes, while final work is done

questions.question: Main goal?
options: A) Restore bite, function and beautiful smile

questions.question: Can implants be part of full mouth rehab?
Risk compared to single crown?
options: A) Longer treatment, higher total cost

questions.question: Who needs it?
options: A) People with severe wear, bite problems or many damaged teeth
